The election must be officially recognized by Elections Canada and documented on their official website.

not_P.title: Will not all of the following occur: (a) Vladimir Putin remains President of Russia until January 1, 2028, (b) the United States does not pass a federal law regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure before January 1, 2028, or (c) Canada does not hold a federal election before January 1, 2028?
not_P.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if not all of the following conditions are met: (a) Vladimir Putin does not remain the President of Russia continuously from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, based on official announcements from the Russian government and reputable news sources; (b) the United States Congress does not pass a federal law specifically regulating the use of artificial intelligence in critical infrastructure (such as power grids, water supply systems, or transportation networks) between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, with the law not signed by the President or not publicly documented in official government records; or (c) Canada does not hold a federal election between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The election must not be officially recognized by Elections Canada and documented on their official website.

Then, will NASA announce a crewed mission to Mars before January 1, 2028? The announcement must be made by an official NASA representative and reported by reputable news sources.

Then, will Sweden implement a nationwide ban on single-use plastics between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Sweden implements such a ban within the specified timeframe, confirmed by an official government announcement and published in Sweden's official legal records.

This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if Sweden does not implement such a ban within the specified timeframe, confirmed by an official government announcement and not published in Sweden's official legal records.

Canada officially announces the construction of a new nuclear power plant between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. The announcement must be made through official government channels and documented in public records.

question.title: Given the US Democratic Party proposes new nuclear safety regulations, will an AI from Musk's companies pass a Turing Test by 2028?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: The United States Democratic Party officially proposes new nuclear safety regulations between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, documented in an official statement or legislative bill introduced by the party. Then, will an artificial intelligence system developed or funded by any of Elon Musk's companies (such as Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink, or OpenAI) pass a formally administered Turing Test before January 1, 2028? The Turing Test must be judged by a panel of at least 5 recognized experts in the field of AI, conducted under controlled conditions, and the results must be published in a peer-reviewed scientific journal.
